The body of water turned out to be a mirage.  Celeron felt stupid that
he fallen for such a simple illusion.  Now he had no idea where he
was, so he just picked a random direction and started walking,
running, and flying.  Taking quick breaks when needed.

After about 4 hours of random wandering, making sure that he was
heading in the same direction and not in circles.  He detected a large
metal mass on the horizon and decided to alter course to see what it
was.  Upon further inspection he found that it was a medium-sized
crashed ship.  It was nothing like that prision ship monstrousity that
he had been involved with before.  He wasn't even sure how long ago
that was, or how he got here.  He could be right near the prision
ship, or this place could be on the other side of the planet.

His adventerous obcession kicked in, and thinking he could find some
useful parts, or even some information he located a hatch, opened it
and began an organized search of the first areas he came to.

On Sun, 3 Oct 2004 22:57:58 -0700, Alex Sell <kraftlos@...> wrote:
> Approximately 4 hours later, Celeron had pushed himself out so that
> everything below his waist was above ground.  Having exausted his
> supply of tolerable music, he decided not to open up his selection of
> mediocre to horrible music and opted for silence.
> 
> The hard part being over, another hour of got him out of the ground.
> He then procede to shut down and run a diagnostic.  He woke up the
> next morning, and tried to figure out where he was, but was unable to
> do so.  Seeing that there was a body of water near by, he decided it
> would be a good landmark to move towards, so he carefully flew toward
> it.....
> 
> (To Be Continued)
